habitat_description: This species was first described from Fern Bank Spring in Little Arkansas, Hays County, Texas (Burger et al. 1950; Lannoo 2005). More recently, this species has been found in Grapevine Cave and T Cave in Blanco County (Chippindale et al. 2000). Found in the Blanco River drainage off the Edwards Plateau (Green et al. 2013). This species has a patchy distribution and may be found in spring outflows. It is important to note that juveniles have been reported in shallow (<1cm) of water, while adults are completely aquatic and are only found near spring outflows, in the gravel substrate, and under rocks or leaves.
